programme.title: Black Shampoo
programme.desc: A black hairdresser's sexual escapades with married customers lead to a confrontation with a jealous mobster.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Gilbert Godfrey hosts; Keith Sweat, Terence Trent D'Arby, Rebbie Jackson, and Oscar Brown III perform.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Host Mary Wilson sings; guests are Whodini, Freddie Jackson, Expose, Michael Bolton, and comedian Willie Asbury.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Mase.

programme.title: Showtime At The Apollo
programme.desc: The host is Gilbert Gottfried; musical guests are Keith Sweat, Terence Trent D'Arby, Rebbie Jackson and Oscar Brown III; comedian is Bobby Slayton.

programme.title: Diamond in the Rough
programme.desc: Ariana is given a chance to turn her life around when she joins a stuffy country club and encounters cliques and an attractive caddy.

programme.title: Inspector Ike
programme.desc: Inspector Ike, a New York City police detective, finds himself in a game of cat-and-mouse after the conniving understudy of an avant-garde theater group knocks off the star actor.

programme.title: How to Snatch a Bachelor
programme.desc: Two sisters make a New Year's resolution to kidnap a reality star bachelor, but they don't account for the FBI being hot on their trails.

programme.title: Black Hollywood
programme.desc: Exploring the roles of black actors, black directors and the black audience in American movies. Shot entirely on location in Hollywood in 1984.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Evan sues his mother Melinda for throwing out his medicinal cannabis; Melinda admits she threw out his cannabis, but claims good intentions due to worrying he may slip into addiction due to her family's genetic predisposition.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Laura is suing DJ for $3,000 for harassment; DJ is countersuing Laura for $3,000 for harassment.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Katie is suing her father for access to her trust fund; Robert says the parameters of the trust fund are clear and it states Katie can have full access when she turns 25 years old.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: Miami; James Belhomme is walking home when killed; John Agudelo never makes it to his car; Officer Octavio Avila is murdered in the line of duty.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: The unsolved murders of Macario Ordonez and Donald Jones.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: The unsolved murders of Rachel Louis and Anthony Williams.

programme.title: Swordfish
programme.desc: A spy (John Travolta) working for the CIA forces a computer hacker (Hugh Jackman), who was recently released from prison, to help steal unused government funds.

programme.title: Gothika
programme.desc: A criminal psychologist (Halle Berry) awakens to find herself confined in a penitentiary, accused of murdering her husband (Charles S. Dutton).

programme.title: Spawn
programme.desc: A clown from Hell allows a badly scarred man, Al Simmons, to return to Earth on a mission to conquer the world. Simmons agrees in hopes of seeing his wife, but must ultimately choose between good and evil.

programme.title: The Black Cobra
programme.desc: A detective (Fred Williamson) protects a murder witness (Eva Grimaldi) from a vicious gang of bikers.

programme.title: The Black Cobra 2
programme.desc: Interpol pairs a Chicago policeman (Fred Williamson) with an inspector (Nicholas Hammond) on the trail of terrorists in Manila.

programme.title: Black Cobra 3: Manila Connection
programme.desc: An agent (Forry Smith) teams up with his father's buddy (Fred Williamson) on a jungle mission to recover stolen weapons.
